item.title: Zola: How a road trip became a viral story of sex trafficking
item.description: The epic Twitter saga of a 19-year-old that attracted thousands of followers hits the big screen.

item.title: Aaliyah's music will finally be available to stream
item.description: The star's music has been out of print for most of the last two decades, after her death in 2001.

item.title: Covid: Live events to be protected by £750m government-backed insurance scheme
item.description: Music festivals are among the events in the UK that will be protected if they are forced to cancel.

item.title: 'It just isn't sustainable' - Why touring in the EU is problematic for UK bands
item.description: One band explain what it's been like trying to tour in France in the age of Covid and Brexit.

item.title: South Park creators sign $900m deal to make seasons and movies
item.description: The agreement comes as technology and media giants battle to dominate the global streaming market.

item.title: Strictly 2021: The line-up so far...
item.description: The actor and children’s TV presenter says he is "buzzing" to join John Whaite, AJ Odudu and others.

item.title: Strike actress wins £11k payout in pregnancy discrimination case
item.description: Antonia Kinlay lost her role in a BBC TV adaptation of one of JK Rowling's crime novels.

item.title: Anything Goes: 'Olympian' efforts needed to launch London musical
item.description: The director of Anything Goes likens her cast to athletes as the Covid-defying production opens.

item.title: Paul Johnson: Chicago house music DJ dies at 50 after catching Covid
item.description: Johnson, who had a 1999 hit with Get Get Down, had been in intensive care with the virus.

item.title: Pride in London parade cancelled for second year
item.description: The UK's biggest LGBT pride festival usually takes place every summer in the capital.

item.title: DaBaby invited to meet HIV charities after onstage comments
item.description: An open letter from 11 prominent organisations calls on the US rapper to help fight misinformation.

item.title: Nearly a third of waking hours spent on TV and streaming, Ofcom says
item.description: Older people have been watching more linear TV while on-demand is a big hit with younger audiences.

item.title: Jack Antonoff has redefined pop music. Here's how
item.description: Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey and Lorde all rely on his advice. Now he's making a statement of his own.

item.title: Barbra Streisand: 'I've always had the right to sing what I want'
item.description: The star looks back at her career, and explains how she's always maintained creative control.

item.title: Bennifer 2.0: How Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck got us talking again
item.description: How a viral photo of Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck exposed the internet's lust for nostalgia.

item.title: Annabel Williams: Behind the scenes secrets of a celebrity vocal coach
item.description: She has voice-trained Amy Winehouse, Jennifer Hudson and reckons she can help anyone to sing.

item.title: EastEnders: 'I was ignorant about my schizophrenia'
item.description: Antonio Ferreira is using his personal experience to advise the soap on a storyline.

item.title: The X Factor: What became of the star-making hit show?
item.description: How the show that once topped viewing figures, and created big stars appears to have run its course.

item.title: Tankus the Henge: Touring in France post-Brexit 'a puzzle'
item.description: Band Tankus the Henge negotiates touring in France, their first trip there since Brexit rules were imposed.

item.title: Becoming Tina Turner in London's West End
item.description: Aisha Jawando takes over from Adrienne Warren in the title role in the musical Tina.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds: `Wrexham - the club and the community are incredible'
item.description: Hollywood star Ryan Reynolds is ‘very, very excited’ to be co-owner of Wrexham, with the new season fast approaching.

item.title: Manga artist from Kenya on his passion for Japanese comics
item.description: Kenyan manga artist Shin explains his passion for Japanese comics and what it takes to make a great one.

item.title: Fisherwomen honoured in photography exhibition
item.description: An exhibition is dedicated to decades of women who have worked in the industry on the east coast.

item.title: Bronze Age sword on display in Fermanagh museum
item.description: The Bronze Age sword had been in private hands since being discovered on the shores of the River Erne in County Fermanagh in 1952.
